value.description: Indicate whether to send the Server Name Indication (SNI) TLS extension in the client hello message.
value.name: use-sni
value.summary: Whether to use Server Name Indication (SNI).

value.display: Permit connections to insecure TLS servers
value.description: Indicate whether to permit connections to TLS servers that do not support RFC 5746 during the TLS handshake. Such servers are vulnerable to man-in-the-middle attacks as documented in CVE-2009-3555. The default setting is <tt>off</tt> .
value.name: permit-insecure-servers
value.summary: Whether to allow connections to TLS servers that do not support RFC 5746.

value.description: Indicate whether to enable TLS compression. Enabling TLS compression in HTTPS is dangerous because the connection becomes vulnerable to the CRIME attack.
value.name: compression
sect163k1

value.description: Do not use custom server name in the SNI extension in the TLS client hello message. Use the host name of the target in the SNI extension instead.
value.name: no
value.summary: Do not use custom server name in the SNI extension

value.description: Use custom server name in the SNI extension in the TLS client hello message.
value.name: yes
value.summary: Use custom server name in the SNI extension

value.description: When set, use the subject DN for host name comparison when the Subject Alternative Name (SAN) extension contains one or more DNS names and no match is found.
value.name: X509_CHECK_FLAG_ALWAYS_CHECK_SUBJECT

value.description: When set, wildcards are not expanded.
value.name: X509_CHECK_FLAG_NO_WILDCARDS

value.description: When set, prevents the expansion of wildcards when used as a prefix ( <tt>*ibm</tt> ) or a suffix ( <tt>ibm*</tt> ).
value.name: X509_CHECK_FLAG_NO_PARTIAL_WILDCARDS

value.description: When set, allows the expansion of wildcards to more than one label. For example, when <tt>*.ibm.com</tt> allows expansion to <tt>www.ibm.com</tt> or <tt>www.dp.ibm.com</tt> .
value.name: X509_CHECK_FLAG_MULTI_LABEL_WILDCARDS

value.description: When set, limits matches to direct child subdomains. For example, when <tt>.ibm.com</tt> matches <tt>www.ibm.com</tt> or <tt>dp.ibm.com</tt> but not <tt>www.dp.ibm.com</tt> .
value.name: X509_CHECK_FLAG_SINGLE_LABEL_SUBDOMAINS

object.name: SSLClientProfile
object.summary: Configure and manage TLS Client Profile.

property.name: mAdminState
property.label: Enable administrative state
property.summary: Set the administrative state of this configuration.
property.hoverhelp: <p>Set the administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set the check box.</li><li>To make inactive, clear the check box.</li></ul>
property.description: <p>The administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set to enabled.</li><li>To make inactive, set to disabled.</li></ul>
Enter a descriptive summary for the configuration.
property.summary: A descriptive summary for the configuration.
property.name: UserSummary
Protocols
property.summary: Which TLS and TLS protocol versions to support.
property.description: Specify the TLS and TLS protocol versions to support.

property.name: Ciphers
property.summary: Which TLS and TLS cipher suites to support in preference order.
property.description: Specify the list of TLS and TLS cipher suites to support. Ensure that the displayed order of cipher suites are in preference order. Otherwise, change the sequence order to meet your preference.
Specify an optional identification credentials that the DataPower Gateway uses to identify itself to a TLS server if client authentication is requested.
property.summary: The credentials to identify the DataPower Gateway to a TLS server.
property.name: Idcred
ValidateServerCert
property.summary: Whether to validate the server certificate during the TLS handshake.
property.description: Indicate whether to validate the server certificate during the TLS handshake.

property.name: Valcred
property.summary: The credentials to validate the authenticity of received certificates.
property.description: Specify an optional set of validation credentials to authenticate the certificate that the TLS server sends during the TLS handshake.

property.name: Caching
property.description: Indicate whether to enable the caching of TLS sessions.

property.name: CacheTimeout
property.summary: The time that TLS sessions are allowed to remain in the TLS session cache.
property.description: Specify the number of seconds that TLS sessions are allowed to remain in the TLS session cache before they are removed. Enter a value in the range 1 - 86400. The default value is 300.

property.name: CacheSize
property.summary: The maximum size of the TLS session cache.
property.description: Specify the maximum number of entries in the session cache. Enter a value in the range 1 - 500000. The default value is 100.
Indicate what kind of features supported by this client.
property.summary: Enable different features supported by this client.
property.name: SSLClientFeatures
EllipticCurves
property.summary: Which elliptic curves to support for TLS EC ciphers.
property.description: Specify the list of elliptic curves to support.

property.name: UseCustomSNIHostname
property.summary: Whether to use a custom server name in the SNI extension in the TLS client hello message
property.description: Set whether to use a custom server name in the SNI extension in the TLS client hello message. By default, the host name of the target is used in the SNI extension.

property.name: CustomSNIHostname
property.summary: User-defined server name in the SNI extension in the TLS client hello message
property.description: Specify the custom server name in the SNI extension in the TLS client hello message.

property.name: ValidateHostname
property.summary: Whether to validate the host name in the server certificate.
property.description: Set whether to validate the host name in the server certificate during the handshake.

property.name: HostnameValidationFlags
property.summary: Fine tune validation methods and settings.
property.description: Set the flags that fine tune the validation methods and settings during the handshake. The default behavior uses the subject DN only when the Subject Alternative Name (SAN) extension contains no DNS names.

property.name: HostnameValidationFailOnError
property.summary: Whether to terminate the handshake when host name validation fails.
property.display: Host name validation fail on error
property.description: Set whether to terminate the handshake when host name validation fails or to ignore the failure, log an event, and continue with server certificate validation. The default behavior is to ignore the failure, log an event, and continue with any configured server certificate validation.

property.name: EnableTLS13Compat
property.summary: Whether to send extra TLS messages to look more like TLSv1.2
property.description: Some network middleboxes may not recognize TLSv1.3 and drop the connection. Enabling this option will send dummy Change Cipher Spec messages which will make TLSv1.3 look more like TLSv1.2.

object.description: Enter TLS Client Profile mode to create or modify a TLS client profile.
